page.title: 02Ditton - Primary Education
page.content: Progressive Ditton had its first C of E school in 1853. An Infants' School (now housing a swimming pool) was built in 1894. These two Victorian buildings coped with the school population until 1953 when two temporary timber classrooms were erected. The pressing need for extra school places came with the housing boom of the 1950's and 60's. Building started in 1958. By 1972, 12 new classrooms plus several in the original Victorian building, were in use. Such was the demand for school places that a separate Infants' school was opened in 1973. Within 10 years, the school roll was falling. Today, some classrooms stand empty and teachers have been redeployed. The original school building has been converted into Ditton Church Centre.
